reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I loved the notes that confirm historical data. I read this book at a time of great sadness and fear as Israel fights again for survival. In my city I worry about antisemitism rearing its uglyhead. I feel humbled by the bravery of these women and children. They were tested in life as I hope no one will ever be again. I read the book in two days beautifully written with truth oozing out of every page.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is a heartwarming and at the time heartbreaking story of a woman’s trauma in taking responsibility for a child that even isn’t hers. Highly recommend this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed this story very much! The only distraction was the narrator missed a few lines or repeated herself 4 or 5 times during the reading. I don’t know if that was due to poor editing or what.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Gut wrenching at times but so interesting. I could not put this book down. If you have an interest in world war II and the holocaust this book is for you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A love story
reviews.reviewText: Great read. A family built out of love, strength and never forgetting where you came from. Highly recommend. A re read for sure

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I was captivated from the very beginning, this author takes you to see the places and situations as if you were there with each character, feeling their hope, desperation, sadness and joy!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars My Daughter’s Keeper
reviews.reviewText: Ilona is a Jew and her husband who died in the war is Catholic. She births a daughter however is turned away by her husbands family except by her sister-in-law. No where to go, Ilona ends up in the ghetto and gives her daughter to her sister-in-law to protect.The story was somewhat hard to follow as for past and present. The brothers reminded me of the two “wild and crazy guys” from SNL. Overall a good read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Based on a True Story....
reviews.reviewText: This book kept me reading, even taking notes to remind me who was who! The will to survive, the reasons to survive, the ability to survive under the inhumane, non God believing rulers of Nazi oppression is almost fiction in itself! How can a group of monsters turn an entire country into vicious, heartless people, who can call themselves Christians, and who are as far from the heart of Christ and God as can be? The Nazi's were handpicked by Satan to war against the God of my Bible!

Rachel & Irena are two delightful characters and two strong women. Rachel is a Jew in Poland studying to be a doctor and falls in love with a handsome military officer, Johann, who just happens to be Catholic. Irena is a Polish Catholic who falls in love with Andre, his twin brother. Johann’s mother is very angry when she is told of the marriage of Johann and proves Anti-Semitism is alive and well. She refuses to recognize the marriage of Johann & Rachel. Hitler’s reign of terror begins as his forces of evil are unleashed on Poland. What follows is a story of the good people who help Irena and Rachel survive 6 years of cruelty. Even after the Germans are gone and the death camps have been revealed, the Polish people continue their persecution of the survivors of those concentration camps. This forces Irena to accept Rachel’s plan to emigrate to Israel because of Ilona, the child of Johann and Rachel and Barauch, a young orphaned boy who Irena and Rachel have raised. It is the only place that these children will ever be accepted.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 19, 2023
reviews.reviewText: A real page turner that was fantastic to read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I could not put this book down. It tore at the heartstrings but also gave an insight into how we are all capable of more than we can ever know.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 13, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This book is hearrbreaking journey of determination and courage. It should be read by everyone.I was engrossed from the beginning It is very well written

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Bought for my sister who loved it , great read , fast delivery and worth the money .
